title: Firefox non supporta multimedia importanti
content: Ho riformattato il PC con windows 10 e ho scaricato Firefox Non mi permette di visualizzare contenuti multimedia tipo: netflix, e twitch. Youtube si. Ricevo dei messaggi di errore tipo: Twitch (Errore #4000), Netflix(F7701-1003) Ho provato tutte le possibili soluzioni trovate online: eliminare la cache/cookie, controllare il DRM e il plugin Widedive nelle impostazioni. Aiutatemi pls Mi sembra impossibile dove cambiare broswer dopo anni per una roba del genere.
creator: massimilian.battelli

title: Can't access Youtube when on Firefox
content:
Problem description: It's been 3 days since I can no longer access Youtube on Firefox on my macbook pro 13. I've been getting this monkey error saying "Oops, something went wrong." Please advise.

Variables: - I'm a user in China. - I'm on the latest version of Firefox (detailed info attached below). - My macOS is up to date (macOS Monterey, detailed info including hardware info given below). - I access Youtube via ExpressVPN (also up to date), as Youtube is still officially blocked in China. - Youtube is accessible on both Safari and Chrome browser on my macbook, with Firefox being the only exception (but Firefox is also my favorite and default browser, which is why I'm trying to fix this). - I've also tried accessing Youtube via Firefox on my windows 10 PC, and all is fine. All other variables remain the same. - All the above tests were done in the exact same internet (wifi) environment. - Conclusion: There's nothing wrong with the local internet, VPN service, or Youtube site. It could only be with either the current build of Firefox for mac, or some unknown settings on my macbook. I can't be certain which is it because I only have 1 macbook hence I can't reproduce or test on another.

My email address for contact: [email removed from public forum]. Looking forward to your prompt reply.

Cheers, Aaron
creator: multimixmeta

title: Connected Services

At the Connected Services screen there is no link or button which provides an explanation - as to what Firefox DOES with the Connected Services. Any positive, constructive information will be appreciated. JFC

title: Firefox randomly opens and closes downloads list
content:
Firefox version: 98.0.2 (64-bit) OS Version: Microsoft Windows 11 Pro 10.0.22000 Build 22000

As I go about my day to day use of the app, I will find that the Downloads list box will randomly open and close itself. This happens several times over a couple hours. If there are no recently downloaded items, then instead of the box opening, it will just add the button and remove it swiftly.

Is this a known issue? Is there a way to fix it? It is very distracting and really makes one paranoid.

title: browsing history in the Mozilla database - is it anonymized?
content: After doing an internet search using Firefox, does the data get anonymized? Is it deleted? If not, how is it protected? Can it be deleted? If not how can it be secured? I'm not concerned about the history on my browser - I know I can delete that from my view. How can I ensure, my search history isn't viewable by Firefox representatives? Also, are there third party providers that collect information that I should know about besides internet service provider(s) (and their partners if applicable or cable service when applicable)?
